title: Minimal Windows 10 Installation as RAM Disk

forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content:
1. How would somebody request a Czech language section over here?: [http://reboot.pro/fo...-international/](http://reboot.pro/forum/138-international/ "")
2. Are there any Czech-fluent reboot.pro people reading this message? There's a fellow who has expressed an interest in paying for help, but after more than 4 hours of excruciating Google Translate interactions, the language barrier has proven to be too much for me to handle without a human, bilingual intermediary.
3. Has anyone ever taken an HDD image of a Windows 10 installation and managed to boot it as a RAM disk, from GRUB4DOS? (Or at least from a BIOS-based boot environment, since GRUB4DOS can chain to other such environments.)

Thank you for your time and have a happy all the things.

forumNotes.author: Camiel
forumNotes.content:
I'm not sure i understand your message but i manage to boot as small as 1.51g Win10 x64 vhd loaded to ram through grub4dos.

I can outline the procedure if anyone is interested but i don't speak Czech.

forumNotes.author: sbaeder
forumNotes.content:
No Czech either, but I would also suggest the VHD approach. I have seen posts here about converting a running system to VHD, and also booting a vhd.

I also know that easy2boot can take a ptn "image" (i.e. a partion image) and pass it to grub4dos to load into RAM to boot. Sounds like some pointes to go by - and yes - remote support is tough enough without any language barrier.

Best of luck!
